citeinfo.title: R2 Water Quality Portal Monitoring Stations

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Environmental Information (OEI)

descript.abstract: The Water Quality Data Portal (WQP) provides an easy way to access data stored in various large water quality databases. The WQP provides various input parameters on the form including location, site, sampling, and date parameters to filter and customize the returned results. The The Water Quality Portal (WQP) is a cooperative service sponsored by the United States Geological Survey (USGS), the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the National Water Quality Monitoring Council (NWQMC) that integrates publicly available water quality data from the USGS National Water Information System (NWIS) the EPA STOrage and RETrieval (STORET) Data Warehouse, and the USDA ARS Sustaining The EarthÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Watersheds - Agricultural Research Database System (STEWARDS).
descript.purpose: The Water Quality Portal WQP can return site information (locations where samples were collected), or it can return sample results (analytical data of collected samples). This ArcGIS SDE point feature class (Geographic NAD83) was generated from a WQP down load of statons in the Region 2 geographic extent.

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 2, GIS Team

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at http://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html)

procstep.procdesc: Ran Site Data Only queries in the Water Quality Portal for NYS, NJ, PR and VI

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 2, GIS Team

procstep.procdesc: Selected out stations in Puerto Rico that were migrated from legacy Storet. Created feature class of these records. and defined project

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 2, GIS Team

procstep.procdesc: Defined projection of of these selected records as GCS-Puerto Rico Datum

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 2, GIS Team

procstep.procdesc: Added XY coordinate values to attribute table of these 386 selected records.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 2, GIS Team

procstep.procdesc: )Created XY coordinate look-up table of these records. and joined table to main feature class (R2_WQP Stations)

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 2, GIS Team

procstep.procdesc: Calculated new Shape values for these records in main feature class using Python expression.
